products.name: Health Savings Account (HSA)
products.description: A tax-advantaged savings account for individuals with high-deductible health plans (HDHPs). Funds can be used for qualified medical expenses.
products.eligibility: Must be covered under an HDHP, not enrolled in Medicare, and cannot be claimed as a dependent on someone else's tax return.
features: Tax-free withdrawals for qualified medical expenses
Funds roll over year to year

products.name: Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
products.description: An employer-sponsored account allowing employees to set aside pre-tax dollars for eligible healthcare or dependent care expenses.
products.eligibility: Offered by employer; specific eligibility criteria may apply.
features: Funds available immediately at the start of the plan year
products.notes: Generally subject to 'use-it-or-lose-it' rule, though some plans offer carryover or grace periods.

products.name: General Purpose Prepaid Card
products.description: A reloadable card not linked to a bank account, usable wherever the card network (e.g., Visa, Mastercard) is accepted.
products.eligibility: Generally available to anyone, subject to identity verification.
features: Can be used for online purchases

products.name: Health Care Spending Account (HCSA)
products.description: Often used interchangeably with Health FSA, but sometimes refers to specific employer-funded arrangements like Health Reimbursement Arrangements (HRAs). Focuses on reimbursing eligible medical expenses.
products.eligibility: Dependent on specific employer plan (FSA or HRA).
features: Typically funded by employer (HRA) or employee pre-tax (FSA)
Used for qualified medical expenses as defined by the IRS
products.notes: Rules vary significantly based on whether it's an FSA or HRA.
